result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph L Harvey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph L Harvey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph L Harvey was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants Huber. 
Court grants 2 days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Per C-31. $1000.00 cash bond posted to be applied to restitution first and then to court costs.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must have no contact with Katie Prudhom.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph L Harvey in court with attorney Thomas O. Mulligan.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.
State moves to delete domestic abuse enhancer on Count 2.  Court amends Count 2 to delete domestic abuse enhancer.
State relates surety requested portion of $1,000.00 bond posted be applied to Restitution.
Court questions defendant.
Victim's rights have been complied with.  Victim's statement filed with Court.
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2 as amended.  Court accepts and finds guilty to Count 2 as amended - misdemeanor battery.
Court orders Count 3 dismissed.
State and Attorney Mulligan relate and recommend joint agreement.
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders: Imposed & Stayed.
Jail: 9 months with huber - Stayed - 2 Days credit if revoked.
Probation:  1 Year.
Restitution:  $607.86
$1,000.00 bond posted first to restitution, then to court costs.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must have no contact with Katie P.
Court costs to include DNA surcharge.

Defendant Joseph L Harvey in court with attorney Thomas O. Mulligan.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reset. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge - Denied not timely

Defendant Joseph L Harvey in court with attorney Thomas O. Mulligan.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Count 1 was previously dismissed.  Count 2 & 3 are both misdemeanors.  Defense waives reading of complaint
  Plea of Not Guilty

CASH BOND DISCUSSED.  Defense requests a signature bond.  State does not object to a reduction but objects to a signature bond.     Court denies the motion for change and previous bond to continue.

  Plea hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
